issue.title: use osgdb_ webp plugin failed to load the grayscale image
issue.body: When I use osgdb_ The webp plugin failed to load the grayscale image.It uses function of WebPPictureImportRGBX.And after executing function of WebPEncode,variable picture's error_code is VP8_ENC_ERROR_NULL_PARAMETER.

issue.title: use osgdb_ webp plugin failed to load the grayscale image
issue.body: When I use osgdb_ The webp plugin failed to load the grayscale image.It uses function of WebPPictureImportRGBX.And after executing function of WebPEncode,variable picture's error_code is VP8_ENC_ERROR_NULL_PARAMETER.

issue.title: use osgdb_ webp plugin failed to load the grayscale image
issue.body: When I use osgdb_ The webp plugin failed to load the grayscale image.It uses function of WebPPictureImportRGBX.And after executing function of WebPEncode,variable picture's error_code is VP8_ENC_ERROR_NULL_PARAMETER.

comment.body: Gotcha.  I don't believe webp supports single band grayscale at all anyway so this isn't something we're going to fix.  The [spec](https://developers.google.com/speed/webp/docs/webp_lossless_bitstream_specification) says "WebP lossless is an image format for lossless compression of ARGB images."

issue.title: use osgdb_ webp plugin failed to load the grayscale image
issue.body: When I use osgdb_ The webp plugin failed to load the grayscale image.It uses function of WebPPictureImportRGBX.And after executing function of WebPEncode,variable picture's error_code is VP8_ENC_ERROR_NULL_PARAMETER.

comment.body: Yes, this image is a png, but loading this png in osgEarth and then exporting it to webp format fails.In other words, the write method of the webp plug-in does not support grayscale images well.

issue.title: See if we can remove GLEW as a dependency
issue.body: IMGUI has it's own extension loader now so we might be able to remove GLEW as a dependency for the imgui stuff.

issue.title: KML model wrong size
KML model wrong size

comment.body:
Right, your model is in inches so if you change the scale in the doc.kml, you get it right:
<Scale><x>0.0254</x><y>0.0254</y><z>0.0254</z></Scale>

issue.title: How to dynamically make a FRAME_BUFFER_OBJECT image from master camera
issue.body:
@gwaldron @all 
Theorically, it's possible to save a dynamic image using FBO model, but it seems to be very difficult for the osgearth master camera  to do it, or even hard for slave camera when sharing the earthmap node. Any one who has the experiene will be appreciated

commits.message:
AnnotationGUI: Namespace issues, fix missing include for dynamic_cast. (#2365)

Co-authored-by: Daniel Emminizer <daniel.emminizer@nrl.navy.mil>

pull_request.title: AnnotationsGUI: Namespace issues, fix missing include for dynamic_cast
pull_request.body:
After fixing my local issue with getting GEOS linking (which I was able to fix in my own internal configuration), I started to get build errors with my own code that was including ImGui/AnnotationsGUI. These fixes allow the code to continue to compile on CentOS 7.9, gcc 11.2.1. Note that this compiles fine inside osgEarth and is only a problem in code that uses osgEarth as a third party library.

AnnotationNode include is required because of a dynamic_cast in the file needing to know how to cast; forward declare is insufficient. Namespace declarations required because external code does not include `using namespace osgEarth; using namespace osgEarth::Util;` like some of the osgEarth examples.

repo.name: osgearth
repo.description: A free open source C++ terrain rendering toolkit.

repo.name: osgearth
repo.description: A 3D Mapping Engine & SDK for OpenSceneGraph.

issue.title: KML model wrong size

comment.body:
Another option is to scale the object in your KML file.

The underlying problem is that the OSG Collada plugin does not scale the model. Rather it just returns the Units information in a plugin data object and expects the user to do the scaling.
